articles.description:
New: When one of the sources download fails, fall back to cache and continue rest of the build.
Chore: Dependency updates
Added docs for Netlify deployment
Fixed #71 #69 #65
Thank you: @sokomin, @molakirlee, @philippnagel, @tianheg

sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine — For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noam Rosenthal)
articles.description: In this second part, Noam suggests a few patterns of how to use the web platform directly as an alternative to some of the solutions that are offered by frameworks.
articles.title: What Web Frameworks Solve: The Vanilla Alternative (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Michelle Barker)
articles.description: In this article, we’ll look specifically at what we can do to reduce the impact of social media embeds and social sharing widgets — or even some strategies to avoid them altogether. While the spotlight is on reducing the environmental impact, many of these tips will be great for performance too.
articles.title: Reducing The Web’s Carbon Footprint: Optimizing Social Media Embeds

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: In this article, Adrian Bece shares more about the benefits and caveats of code-splitting and how page performance and load times can be improved by dynamically loading expensive, non-critical JavaScript bundles.
articles.title: Improving JavaScript Bundle Performance With Code-Splitting

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: It’s shipping! Meet “Touch Design for Mobile Interfaces”, our brand-new guide with guidelines and best practices to improve usability and accessibility on mobile. 400 pages. For designers and developers working with mobile UIs.
articles.title: Meet “Touch Design For Mobile Interfaces”, A New Smashing Book

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Do you need a little inspiration boost? Well, then our new batch of desktop wallpapers is for you. Designed by artists and designers from across the globe, they come in versions with and without a calendar for February 2022.
articles.title: 28 Days Of Inspiration (February 2022 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Noam Rosenthal)
articles.description: In this article, Noam Rosenthal dives deep into a few technical features that are common across frameworks, and explains how some of the different frameworks implement them and what they cost.
articles.title: What Web Frameworks Solve And How To Do Without Them (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Shell Zhu & Adrian Jones)
articles.description: This article reveals how something as trivial as administration in both software and As-a-service can be either a booster or bottleneck to a company’s productivity and innovation. It also provides several design aspects that UX practitioners should evaluate when designing the administration experience.
articles.title: Don’t Underestimate The Software Administration UX

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Patrick Brosset)
articles.description: What’s new in Chrome, Edge, Safari and Firefox? Patrick Brosset breaks it down with the latest features in DevTools across browsers.
articles.title: What’s New In DevTools?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Eckles)
articles.description: Cascade layers introduce the new at-rule of @layer. The intent is to help CSS authors be more intentional about ordering the “layers” of CSS rules as a new method of cascade management.
articles.title: Getting Started With CSS Cascade Layers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Javier Cuello)
articles.description: Joining a team where there are no established design practices may feel disheartening. Does this situation resonate with you? If yes, then read on — as this article is sharing the author’s advice based on his personal experience and it will show you a way (although not easy) of facing the problem in a manner that will bring other benefits, beside order and consistency.
articles.title: From Chaos To System In Design Teams

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Georgii Perepecho)
articles.description: In this article, Georgii Perepecho explains the most common React Query features that you need to be familiar with when creating a real-life application that is stable when testing.
articles.title: Building The Real App With React Query

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What goes into creating a successful design system? How can you take your testing workflow to the next level? And what smart interface design patterns could help you enhance your UIs? Let’s figure it out. With our [online workshops on front-end and UX](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops).
articles.title: Upcoming Online Workshops: January – May 2022

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Anton Tyschenko)
articles.description: Every once in a while, we publish [freebies](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/category/freebies) related to different occasions and themes. We hope that with this icon set, everyone will be able to find their own use case for these icons in particular. Today, we present to you three icon sets designed by the creative folks at GraphicSurf — all free for personal and commercial use.
articles.title: Freebie: Wayfinding Icon Sets (164 Icons, PNG, SVG, AI, EPS)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: We’ll explore fluid typography principles, use-cases, implementation with CSS clamp() and an interactive fluid typography calculator.
articles.title: Modern Fluid Typography Using CSS Clamp

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In [Part 1](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2022/01/ten-tips-aspiring-designer-beginners-part1/), Luis Ouriach shared advice he wished he had when starting out in his career. In this second and last part of this series, Luis continues sharing tips that helped him grow and become a better designer throughout the years.
articles.title: Ten Tips For Aspiring Designer Beginners (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Daniel Don)
articles.description: If you’re a developer who’s thinking about building a platform that requires a code editor in one form or another, then this article is for you. This article explains how to create a web code editor that displays the result in real time with the help of some HTML, CSS and JavaScript.
articles.title: Building A Web Code Editor

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Kate Kalcevich)
articles.description: Accessibility must be a permanent program within organizations, much like security. In this article, Kate Kalcevich shares tips on which skills and questions to keep in mind when hiring for digital accessibility roles.
articles.title: How To Hire For Digital Accessibility Roles

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ahmad Shadeed)
articles.description: In this article, we’ll be taking a closer look at two gradients: `conic-gradient` and `radial-gradient`. You’ll see how each one of them works in detail, what the differences and similarities are between them, how and where to use them, and some use cases for each.
articles.title: A Deep CSS Dive Into Radial And Conic Gradients

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Scott Himmer)
articles.description: Product roadmaps are often treated as a series of checkboxes. But they are more than that. In this article, Scott Himmer explains how internal partnerships, research, design systems, and regular touch bases can help make sure that your product roadmap is a successful one.
articles.title: Changing A Tire On A Moving Car (Or How To Improve Product Roadmaps)

articles.author: Nuno Bispo
articles.description: Heroku is a well-known PaaS widely used by developers. And as a fun and useful project, you can easily make your own Heroku-like PaaS with Dokku. What is Heroku? Heroku is a platform as a service (PaaS) company founded in 2007. The platform runs on AWS, and its ephemeral storage
articles.title: How to Build Your Own Heroku with Dokku

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: In this article, we will talk about arrays in Java. We will go over some examples to help you understand what an array is, how to declare them, and how to use them in your Java code. What is an array? In Java, you use an array to store multiple
articles.title: Java Array – How to Declare and Initialize an Array in Java Example

articles.author: Sampurna Chapagain
articles.description: If you are a Google Chrome user, you've probably used some extensions in the browser.  Have you ever wondered how to build one yourself? In this article, I will show you how you can create a Chrome extension from scratch. Table Of Contents  * What is a Chrome
articles.title: How to Create Your Own Google Chrome Extension

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: You are just about to learn about 20 great examples of code from 20 insanely talented developers. Js13kGames is a JavaScript coding competition open to everyone and anyone wanting to try out Game Development. The 2021 winners have been announced, and you can play the games for free. As the
articles.title: 20 Award-Winning JavaScript Games – js13kGames 2021 Winners

articles.author: Beau Carnes
articles.description: Unreal Engine is one of the most popular game engines in use today. It can be helpful to learn if you are interested in 3D or 2D game development. We just published an Unreal Engine 5 crash course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel. Varnos Games created this course. You will
articles.title: Unreal Engine 5 Crash Course with Blueprint

articles.author: Ihechikara Vincent Abba
articles.description: In this tutorial, we will go over commonly used HTML tags, elements, and attributes. We'll also see examples of how these tags, elements, and attributes work. You can use this article as a reference guide whether you're a beginner or experienced developer. What Makes Up an HTML Document? The following
articles.title: HTML Cheat Sheet – HTML Elements List Reference

articles.author: Kolade Chris
articles.description: If you're working on a web development project, setting a nice background color can give the website a more enticing look. To set a background color for a div or related element in CSS, you use the  background-color property. While setting this background color, your creativity is your limit
articles.title: Div Background Color – How to Change Background Color in CSS

articles.author: Jean-Marc Möckel
articles.description: Two years ago, I started to learn and use React. And today I'm still using it at my day job as a Software Developer and in my own side projects. During that time I've come across a lot of "typical" issues. So I searched around and found some best practices
articles.title: React Best Practices – Tips for Writing Better React Code in 2022

articles.author: Kolade Chris
articles.description: You use the HTML <label> tag to caption form controls. <label> is an inline element – meaning it doesn't take up an entire line unless you put a break tag before it. By definition, form controls refer to the elements inside a form element. Examples of form controls include <input
articles.title: HTML Label – Label Tag Example

articles.author: Njoku Samson Ebere
articles.description: If you are just starting out in tech but do not know which path to take, then this article is for you. If you've started learning, but you're still confused on which programming language or tools to choose, don't worry – we'll discuss that here. And if you've ever wondered
articles.title: How to Get Started in Tech
